CVE-2023-26211
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-22T14:33:54.453000

2 posts

An improper neutralization of input during web page generation ('cross-site scripting') in Fortinet FortiSOAR 7.3.0 through 7.3.2 allows an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the Communications module.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.511Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

#Fortinet #cve #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.000Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

CVE-2021-31196
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.17%

updated 2024-08-22T14:13:46.367000

8 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/hosch3n/ProxyVulns

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T14:40:38.457Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Super hot off the press!!! NOTE: I'm so quick that CISA hasn't even started the blog post yet, generating a Page Not Found page. I have it on good authority that the following are added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow
  • CVE-2021-31196 (7.2 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

Edit: Until that link works above, or someone corrects me, heres's a link to CISA's KEV Catalog

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow
  • CVE-2021-31196 (7.2 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

##

CVE-2022-0185
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2024-08-22T13:35:00.450000

8 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way the legacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of the Linux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (in case of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespaced CAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does not support the Filesystem Context API (and thu

Super hot off the press!!! NOTE: I'm so quick that CISA hasn't even started the blog post yet, generating a Page Not Found page. I have it on good authority that the following are added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow

CVE-2024-7971
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-22T12:48:02.790000

19 posts

Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.84 allowed a remote attacker to exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T20:37:52.256Z ##

Google Chrome Zero Day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
This update includes 38 security fixes. (20 externally reported). CVE-2024-7971 (high severity) Type confusion in V8
Reported by Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center (MSTIC), Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) on 2024-08-19

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @cR0w @regnil @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium @AAKL (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

(6.5 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-08-22T12:48:02.790000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to obtain sensitive information from an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper enforcement of administrative privilege levels for high-value sensitive data. An attacker with read-only Administrator privileges for the web-based management int

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T16:12:40.117Z ##

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-20417
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-22T12:48:02.790000

2 posts

Multiple vulnerabilities in the REST API of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct blind SQL injection attacks. These vulnerabilities are due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input in REST API calls. An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending crafted input to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow th

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

updated 2024-08-21T16:06:23.153000

1 repos

https://github.com/explls/CVE-2024-28000

geekland@mastodon.social at 2024-08-22T11:31:34.000Z ##

Record-Breaking Bounty Awarded For LiteSpeed Cache Plugin Vulnerability #announcements #litespeed_web_server #news #security #wordpress #cve_2024_28000 #litespeed_cache #patchstack #plugin
https://ostechnix.com/litespeed-cache-plugin-vulnerability/

##
decio at 2024-08-21T18:26:26.109Z ##

"Litespeed Cache bug exposes millions of WordPress sites to takeover attacks"

"A critical vulnerability in the LiteSpeed Cache WordPress plugin can let attackers take over millions of websites after creating rogue admin accounts.

LiteSpeed Cache is open-source and the most popular WordPress site acceleration plugin, with over 5 million active installations and support for WooCommerce, bbPress, ClassicPress, and Yoast SEO."
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/litespeed-cache-bug-exposes-millions-of-wordpress-sites-to-takeover-attacks/

#CyberVeille #wordpress #CVE_2024_28000

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T18:26:26.000Z ##

"Litespeed Cache bug exposes millions of WordPress sites to takeover attacks"

"A critical vulnerability in the LiteSpeed Cache WordPress plugin can let attackers take over millions of websites after creating rogue admin accounts.

LiteSpeed Cache is open-source and the most popular WordPress site acceleration plugin, with over 5 million active installations and support for WooCommerce, bbPress, ClassicPress, and Yoast SEO."
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/litespeed-cache-bug-exposes-millions-of-wordpress-sites-to-takeover-attacks/

CVE-2024-38474
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.57%

updated 2024-08-21T15:31:56

1 posts

Substitution encoding issue in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows attacker to execute scripts in directories permitted by the configuration but not directly reachable by any URL or source disclosure of scripts meant to only to be executed as CGI. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60, which fixes this issue. Some RewriteRules that capture and substitute unsa

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-09T14:49:06.000Z ##

F5 confirmed that their BIG-IP, BIG-IQ and Traffix SDC are vulnerable to Apache HTTPD vulnerabilities CVE-2024-38474 and CVE-2024-38475 (see parent toot above for information on these vulnerabilities).

If you missed this, #GitHub Has Patched a Critical Security Flaw in Enterprise Server Granting Admin Privileges - CVE-2024-6800 https://thehackernews.com/2024/08/github-patches-critical-security-flaw.html @thehackernews #cybersecurity #Infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.030Z ##

GitHub security advisories from 20 August 2024:

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

The big one is CVE-2024-6800 (9.5 critical):

On GitHub Enterprise Server instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with specific IdPs utilizing publicly exposed signed federation metadata XML, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user account with site administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. h/t to Qualys: GitHub Patches Multiple Security Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-6800, CVE-2024-6337, & CVE-2024-7711)

#cve #vulnerability #github #PatchTuesday

updated 2024-08-20T21:31:32

2 posts

An information exposure vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables a local system administrator to unintentionally disclose secrets, passwords, and tokens of external systems. 2 posts

An Incorrect Authorization vulnerability was identified in GitHub Enterprise Server, allowing an attacker to update the title, assignees, and labels of any issue inside a public repository. This was only exploitable inside a public repository. This vulnerability affected GitHub Enterprise Server versions before 3.14 and was fixed in versions 3.13.3, 3.12.8, and 3.11.14. Versions 3.10 of GitHub Ent

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.030Z ##

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

On GitHub Enterprise Server instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with specific IdPs utilizing publicly exposed signed federation metadata XML, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user account with site administrator privileges.

##

CVE-2024-38175
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

2 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in the Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra allows an authenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T18:55:08.905Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38175
CVE-2024-38175 (9.6 critical) Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)

An attacker with permissions to deploy User Defined Functions (UDF) in an Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra cluster can send specially crafted requests to the underlying host and extract credentials for managed identities of other clusters on the same host node. The compromised credentials enable the attacker to impersonate the victim's managed identity and retrieve information from other clusters hosted on the node which could be outside of the attacker's tenant.
The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38175 #Azure #ApacheCassandra #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T18:55:08.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38175
CVE-2024-38175 (9.6 critical) Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)

An attacker with permissions to deploy User Defined Functions (UDF) in an Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra cluster can send specially crafted requests to the underlying host and extract credentials for managed identities of other clusters on the same host node. The compromised credentials enable the attacker to impersonate the victim's managed identity and retrieve information from other clusters hosted on the node which could be outside of the attacker's tenant.
The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38175 #Azure #ApacheCassandra #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-39383
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-08-20T19:26:34.947000

2 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 20.005.30636, 24.002.20965, 24.002.20964, 24.001.30123 and earlier are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T18:21:41.501Z ##

Adobe security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • APSB24-45 Security update available for Adobe Illustrator (7 CVEs)
  • APSB24-47 Security update available for Adobe Dimension (6)
  • APSB24-49 Security update available for Adobe Photoshop (1)
  • APSB24-56 Security update available for Adobe InDesign (13)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat Reader (12)
  • APSB24-59 Security update available for Adobe Bridge (3)
  • APSB24-60 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Stager (1)
  • APSB24-61 Security update available for Adobe Commerce (23)
  • APSB24-64 Security update available for Adobe InCopy (1)
  • APSB24-65 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Sampler (4)
  • APSB24-67 Security update available for Adobe Substance 3D Designer (1)

Unfortunately the potentially exploited zero-day did not pan out, as there is no mention of exploitation in the Adobe Reader security advisory. See parent toots above for additional information about that one. Haifei Li of EXPMON and Check Point Research are credited for CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high) Use After Free vulnerability (impact: arbitrary code execution).

#Adobe #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-14T17:37:36.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5914 Cortex XSOAR: Command Injection in CommonScripts Pack (CVSSv4: 7.0 high)
  • CVE-2024-5916 PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of External System Secrets (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium)
  • CVE-2024-5915 GlobalProtect App: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium)
  • PAN-SA-2024-0007 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates 31 Chromium CVEs from 6772-6779, 6988-6991, 6994-7001, 7003-7005, 7255-7256, 7533-7536, 7550. These CVEs are fixed in Prisma Access Browser 1.0 (supersedes Talon Browser), and all later Prisma Access Browser versions.

"Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

#panw #paloaltonetworks #patchtuesday #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-5932
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2024-08-20T15:44:20.567000

8 posts

The GiveWP – Donation Plugin and Fundraising Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 3.14.1 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'give_title' parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. The additional presence of a POP chain allows attackers to execute code remotely, and to dele

##

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.08%

updated 2024-08-20T13:34:22.773000

16 posts

Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable a feature of its CLI command parser that replaces an '@' character followed by a file path in an argument with the file's contents, allowing unauthenticated attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

Nuclei template

threatcodex at 2024-08-22T14:06:03.506Z ##

The Hidden Door: How CVE-2024-23897 Enabled Ransomware Attack on Indian Banks
#CVE_2024_23897
https://blogs.juniper.net/en-us/threat-research/cve-2024-23897-enabled-ransomware-attack-on-indian-banks

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T14:30:27.315Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical, disclosed 24 January 2024 by Jenkins, has Proof of Concept) Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability added to KEV Catalog.

#CISA #Jenkins #CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T18:37:30.648Z ##

Juniper: The Hidden Door: How CVE-2024-23897 Enabled Ransomware Attack on Indian Banks
In case you haven't patched your Jenkins server already, CVE-2024-23897 (9.8 critical, disclosed 24 January 2024 by Jenkins, has Proof of Concept) is still being actively exploited. This time, Juniper pivots off of CloudSEK research and found that the ransomware group RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to target Indian banks (01 August 2024 cyberattack on Brontoo Technology Solutions). Technical analysis of the vulnerability and the proof of concept provided. No IOC available.

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #ransomware

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.000Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.000Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

CVE-2024-21689
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T12:30:27

3 posts

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability CVE-2024-21689  was introduced in versions 9.1.0, 9.2.0, 9.3.0, 9.4.0, 9.5.0, and 9.6.0 of Bamboo Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 7.6, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-39792
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-19T16:20:28.967000

2 posts

When the NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT pre-read module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.  Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T13:23:49.362Z ##

F5 Security advisories. No mention of exploitation:

  • K000140111: BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerability CVE-2024-39809
    • CVE-2024-39809 (CVSSv4 8.9 high) BIG-IP Next Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire.
  • K000140108: NGINX Plus MQTT vulnerability CVE-2024-39792
    • CVE-2024-39792 (CVSSv4 8.7 high) When NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT filter module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T13:23:49.000Z ##

F5 Security advisories. No mention of exploitation:

  • K000140111: BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerability CVE-2024-39809
    • CVE-2024-39809 (CVSSv4 8.9 high) BIG-IP Next Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire.
  • K000140108: NGINX Plus MQTT vulnerability CVE-2024-39792
    • CVE-2024-39792 (CVSSv4 8.7 high) When NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT filter module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-7646
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-19T13:00:23.117000

3 posts

A security issue was discovered in ingress-nginx where an actor with permission to create Ingress objects (in the `networking.k8s.io` or `extensions` API group) can bypass annotation validation to inject arbitrary commands and obtain the credentials of the ingress-nginx controller. In the default configuration, that credential has access to all secrets in the cluster.

1 repos

https://github.com/UgOrange/CVE-2024-7646-poc

mydoomfr@mamot.fr at 2024-08-18T17:22:11.000Z ##

CVE-2024-7646 Ingress-nginx Annotation Validation Bypass

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/126744

#nginx #kubernetes #k8s #cve

##

CVE-2024-44069
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-19T12:59:59.177000

1 posts

Pi-hole before 6 allows unauthenticated admin/api.php?setTempUnit= calls to change the temperature units of the web dashboard. NOTE: the supplier reportedly does "not consider the bug a security issue" but the specific motivation for letting arbitrary persons change the value (Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin), seen by the device owner, is unclear.

iampytest1 at 2024-08-19T21:55:11.745Z ##

PiHole let unauthenticated actors change... temperature systems.

https://github.com/pi-hole/web/pull/3077
https://www.kiyell.com/The-Harmless-Pihole-Bug/

#PiHole #PiHoleSecurity #CVE202444069

##

CVE-2024-42318
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-19T12:59:59.177000

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: landlock: Don't lose track of restrictions on cred_transfer When a process' cred struct is replaced, this _almost_ always invokes the cred_prepare LSM hook; but in one special case (when KEYCTL_SESSION_TO_PARENT updates the parent's credentials), the cred_transfer LSM hook is used instead. Landlock only implements the cred_prep

alip@mastodon.online at 2024-08-18T07:06:37.000Z ##

#sydbox uses #landlock, however we're not affected by CVE-2024-42318 because we deny the keyctl system call by default, secure defaults #ftw: https://www.cve.org/CVERecord/?id=CVE-2024-42318 #sandbox #break

##

CVE-2024-6500
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-08-17T03:30:31

2 posts

The InPost for WooCommerce plugin and InPost PL plugin for WordPress are vulnerable to unauthorized access and deletion of data due to a missing capability check on the 'parse_request' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0 (for InPost for WooCommerce) as well as 1.4.4 (for InPost PL). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to read and delete arbitrary files on Windows

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox

##

CVE-2024-43472
(5.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-16T21:32:47

8 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-16T19:45:18.951Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-43472 (5.8 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
Okay if you were following along with my parent toot, the CVE got published. The impact is browser sandbox escape, and there's some conflicting information in the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section about no effect on Integrity or Availability, which is contradicted in the CVSSv3.1 vector and in the next question.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would first have to log on to the system. An attacker could then run a specially crafted application that could exploit the vulnerability and take control of an affected system.

Additionally, an attacker could convince a local user to open a malicious file. The attacker would have to convince the user to click a link, typically by way of an enticement in an email or instant message, and then convince them to open the specially crafted file.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, Exploitation Less Likely.

#CVE_2024_43472 #Edge #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-16T16:21:04.894Z ##

Microsoft security advisory: Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates
Normally I don't bother talking about Microsoft Edge since it just gets updated against Google Chrome-announced CVEs from earlier in the week. What's unique this time, is that the most recent Google Chrome update (see parent toot above) contains no security fixes.

This update contains the following Microsoft Edge-specific update: CVE-2024-43472

The vulnerability page doesn't exist, and MITRE hasn't updated it beyond "RESERVED". So we don't know what this is yet.

#CVE_2024_43472 #Microsoft #Edge #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T19:45:18.000Z ##

CVE-2024-38063
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-16T20:54:12.043000

109 posts

Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

7 repos

https://github.com/dweger-scripts/CVE-2024-38063-Remediation

https://github.com/diegoalbuquerque/CVE-2024-38063

https://github.com/almogopp/Disable-IPv6-CVE-2024-38063-Fix

https://github.com/p33d/cve-2024-38063

https://github.com/Sachinart/CVE-2024-38063-POC

axels@mastodon.social at 2024-08-21T16:58:10.000Z ##

PSA: Bad bug in #Windows update! Turn off IPv6 and update #CVE202438063

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

This is a zero click vulnerability, meaning you are vulnerable and don't need to click on anything to get exploited.

If you run Windows and have #IPv6, please turn it off. You need these updates to address the bug:

https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571

#CyberSecurity

🚨
Windows TCP/IP RCE CVSS 9.8 out of 10.
An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.945Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket #rca

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.474Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... But what we've seen so far illustrates a very important point. That the vulnerability can't be triggered with a single packet. In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

Read the whole thread with the technical jargon if you can't understand my summary. His take is that 9.8 severity is overblown because "at best we're talking about a remote denial of service and full RCE is intractable in this case."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-19T02:48:13.469Z ##

Let's do a quick PoC check-in for #CVE_2024_38063, the IPv6 takeover bug in Windows, shall we?

This cute lil friend isn't even source code. Just an executable, which I will be taking apart tonight.

This Python repo, unless I'm misreading it, is utter BS that just does a dramatic reenactment of an exploit.

And this empty repo comes from one of the most vapory GH profiles I've seen in some time.

I'm sure I missed one, and I'm sure y'all will find it. But right now, seems like this thing is still theoretical. Of course patch, but do not panic.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-17T02:13:42.989Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber does it again: Regarding CVE-2024-38063 IPV6 RCE in Windows...
I saw this mentioned earlier on Mastodon but didn't get to boost it. Robel was able to create a PoC that causes a crash. His RCA on CVE-2024-38063:

The bug check in this case isn't too detailed, but essentially the underflow creates a large value used in a loop which eventually write data out of bounds and causes a crash.
I imagine this can be weaponized using heap massaging techniques and corrupting adjacent objects in the heap.

h/t: @decio

#CVE_2024_38063 #vulnerability #microsoft #ipv6 #cve

##
decio at 2024-08-16T07:37:10.114Z ##

https://x.com/RobelCampbell/status/1824134678317580561

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-14T22:25:02.209Z ##

What am I missing with the reporting about #CVE_2024_38063?

I haven't seen a PoC. I don't know that even the reporters were able to demonstrate RCE. "Exploitation More Likely" does not mean "We received a working PoC for RCE from the reporter." At least, I don't think so. And it's not in the wild, right? So is this just a "no-click" hypetrain?

Let's find out how I'm wrong!

msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

##
decio at 2024-08-14T12:14:21.613Z ##

ouep, dans le🩹 patch tuesday Microsoft , sur le papier, celui-là a l'air vraiment croustillant
⬇️

Impact: Remote Code Execution

Max Severity: Critical

CVSS:3.1 9.8

Un attaquant non authentifié peut exploiter la vulnérabilité en envoyant de manière répétée des paquets IPv6, incluant des paquets spécialement conçus, à une machine Windows. Cette exploitation pourrait permettre l'exécution de code à distance sur le système cible

attribué à CyberKunlun

Attack Vector➡️ Network
Attack Complexity➡️ Low

👇
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063

SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

##
biffbiffbiff@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-14T10:53:36.000Z ##

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063
🚨
Windows TCP/IP RCE CVSS 9.8 out of 10.
An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.

#threatintel
#infosecurity #cve202438063

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.945Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket #rca

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.474Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... But what we've seen so far illustrates a very important point. That the vulnerability can't be triggered with a single packet. In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

Read the whole thread with the technical jargon if you can't understand my summary. His take is that 9.8 severity is overblown because "at best we're talking about a remote denial of service and full RCE is intractable in this case."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-19T02:48:13.469Z ##

Let's do a quick PoC check-in for #CVE_2024_38063, the IPv6 takeover bug in Windows, shall we?

This cute lil friend isn't even source code. Just an executable, which I will be taking apart tonight.

This Python repo, unless I'm misreading it, is utter BS that just does a dramatic reenactment of an exploit.

And this empty repo comes from one of the most vapory GH profiles I've seen in some time.

I'm sure I missed one, and I'm sure y'all will find it. But right now, seems like this thing is still theoretical. Of course patch, but do not panic.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-17T02:13:42.989Z ##

Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber does it again: Regarding CVE-2024-38063 IPV6 RCE in Windows...
I saw this mentioned earlier on Mastodon but didn't get to boost it. Robel was able to create a PoC that causes a crash. His RCA on CVE-2024-38063:

The bug check in this case isn't too detailed, but essentially the underflow creates a large value used in a loop which eventually write data out of bounds and causes a crash.
I imagine this can be weaponized using heap massaging techniques and corrupting adjacent objects in the heap.

h/t: @decio

#CVE_2024_38063 #vulnerability #microsoft #ipv6 #cve

decio at 2024-08-16T07:37:10.114Z ##

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-14T22:25:02.209Z ##

What am I missing with the reporting about #CVE_2024_38063?

I haven't seen a PoC. I don't know that even the reporters were able to demonstrate RCE. "Exploitation More Likely" does not mean "We received a working PoC for RCE from the reporter." At least, I don't think so. And it's not in the wild, right? So is this just a "no-click" hypetrain?

Let's find out how I'm wrong!

msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

##
decio at 2024-08-14T12:14:21.613Z ##

ouep, dans le🩹 patch tuesday Microsoft , sur le papier, celui-là a l'air vraiment croustillant
⬇️

Impact: Remote Code Execution

Max Severity: Critical

CVSS:3.1 9.8

Un attaquant non authentifié peut exploiter la vulnérabilité en envoyant de manière répétée des paquets IPv6, incluant des paquets spécialement conçus, à une machine Windows. Cette exploitation pourrait permettre l'exécution de code à distance sur le système cible

attribué à CyberKunlun

Attack Vector➡️ Network
Attack Complexity➡️ Low

👇
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.000Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.000Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.690Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-16T09:40:03.000Z ##

Windows et Windows Server impactés par une faille de sécurité critique dans IPv6 ! https://www.it-connect.fr/windows-faille-critique-dans-ipv6-cve-2024-38063/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #Microsoft

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-16T05:40:22.606Z ##

Has anyone else looked at CVE-2024-38063? I could use a sanity check here. From what I can see, the vulnerable code path can only be triggered with IPv6 Jumbograms (packets larger than 65535 bytes). Not only would the target system need to have Jumbograms enabled, but every link in the path between the attacker and target would have to both support Jumbograms and have them enabled. I can't imagine any real world scenario in which this would occur, so unless I'm missing something, this vulnerability could only be exploited on very few real world systems.

##
JuanPC@mastodon.online at 2024-08-16T05:27:51.000Z ##

##
nikolozk at 2024-08-15T10:18:05.034Z ##

Critical Windows IPv6 vulnerability (CVE-2024-38063) requires immediate patching:

• Affects all Windows systems with IPv6 enabled (default setting)
• Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability caused by Integer Underflow
• Exploitable by unauthenticated attackers using crafted IPv6 packets
• Low-complexity attack could lead to arbitrary code execution

Microsoft emphasizes high-priority treatment, citing past exploitation of similar vulnerabilities.

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/zero-click-windows-tcp-ip-rce-impacts-all-systems-with-ipv6-enabled-patch-now/

Well, well, well.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T03:04:50.672Z ##

@kaur Thank you for highlighting CVE-2024-38063. I was so focused on the zero days that I overlooked this.

I'm trying to visualize the technical details from the limited information:

  • CWE-191: Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound)
  • An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.
  • Systems are not affected if IPv6 is disabled on the target machine.
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

avuko@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-18T14:40:54.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.000Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-16T09:40:03.000Z ##

Windows et Windows Server impactés par une faille de sécurité critique dans IPv6 ! https://www.it-connect.fr/windows-faille-critique-dans-ipv6-cve-2024-38063/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #Microsoft

##
malwaretech@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T05:40:22.000Z ##

Has anyone else looked at CVE-2024-38063? I could use a sanity check here. From what I can see, the vulnerable code path can only be triggered with IPv6 Jumbograms (packets larger than 65535 bytes). Not only would the target system need to have Jumbograms enabled, but every link in the path between the attacker and target would have to both support Jumbograms and have them enabled. I can't imagine any real world scenario in which this would occur, so unless I'm missing something, this vulnerability could only be exploited on very few real world systems.

##
padraig@mastodon.ie at 2024-08-15T23:08:41.000Z ##

RCE Vulnerability Affects All Windows Systems Using IPv6

"An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution."

CVE-2024-38063
CVSS: 9.8

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

(To fix: Disable IPv6 within Network Settings)

##
floe@hci.social at 2024-08-14T22:23:44.000Z ##

Well, well, well.

A remote code execution vulnerability, right in the Windows IPv6 stack. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

Anyone remember the Win95 ping of death, or the Conficker worm? This has the potential to make the Crowdstrike outage look harmless in comparison.

Popcorn.

(Only reason this doesn't have a straight 10.0 as CVE severity score is probably because IPv6 coverage is still abysmal. 🤭)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-14T03:04:50.000Z ##

@kaur Thank you for highlighting CVE-2024-38063. I was so focused on the zero days that I overlooked this.

I'm trying to visualize the technical details from the limited information:

  • CWE-191: Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound)
  • An unauthenticated attacker could repeatedly send IPv6 packets, that include specially crafted packets, to a Windows machine which could enable remote code execution.
  • Systems are not affected if IPv6 is disabled on the target machine.
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

CVE-2024-28986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.98%

updated 2024-08-16T15:04:28.150000

21 posts

SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine. While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing.   However, out of an abundance of caution, we recomm

shaknais@mastodon.social at 2024-08-18T23:22:50.000Z ##

Solarwinds runs eval on delivered data. As such federal agencies are required to immediately mitigate.

It's not groundhog day... But it certainly feels like it.

https://www.solarwinds.com/trust-center/security-advisories/cve-2024-28986

https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/directives/bod-22-01-reducing-significant-risk-known-exploited-vulnerabilities

#CyberSecurity #SolarWinds

screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T14:23:59.638Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-28986 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by SolarWinds) SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Note: There was no indication that CVE-2024-28986 was being exploited in the wild in the security advisory.

cc: @campuscodi h/t: @hrbrmstr

##
jbhall56 at 2024-08-15T11:27:08.957Z ##

The company has released a hotfix and says that the security issue, tracked as CVE-2024-28986, is a Java deserialization that would allow an attacker to run commands on a vulnerable host machine. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/solarwinds-fixes-critical-rce-bug-affecting-all-web-help-desk-versions/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T18:11:25.255Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28986)
CVE-2024-28986 (CVSSv3: 9.8 critical) SolarWinds Web Help Desk was found to be susceptible to a Java Deserialization Remote Code Execution vulnerability that, if exploited, would allow an attacker to run commands on the host machine.

Note: While it was reported as an unauthenticated vulnerability, SolarWinds has been unable to reproduce it without authentication after thorough testing. Thus CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SolarWinds fixes critical RCE bug affecting all Web Help Desk versions

#CVE_2024_28986 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-29415
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-16T14:35:01.260000

1 posts

The ip package through 2.0.1 for Node.js might allow SSRF because some IP addresses (such as 127.1, 01200034567, 012.1.2.3, 000:0:0000::01, and ::fFFf:127.0.0.1) are improperly categorized as globally routable via isPublic. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2023-42282.

1 repos

https://github.com/felipecruz91/node-ip-vex

CVE-2024-29857
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-15T21:38:17

2 posts

An issue was discovered in ECCurve.java and ECCurve.cs in Bouncy Castle Java (BC Java) before 1.78, BC Java LTS before 2.73.6, BC-FJA before 1.0.2.5, and BC C# .Net before 2.3.1. Importing an EC certificate with crafted F2m parameters can lead to excessive CPU consumption during the evaluation of the curve parameters.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-38653
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-15T17:32:57.587000

2 posts

XXE in SmartDeviceServer in Ivanti Avalanche 6.3.1 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to read arbitrary files on the server.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.847Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

CVE-2024-4577
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.32%

updated 2024-08-14T19:23:47.253000

6 posts

In PHP versions 8.1.* before 8.1.29, 8.2.* before 8.2.20, 8.3.* before 8.3.8, when using Apache and PHP-CGI on Windows, if the system is set up to use certain code pages, Windows may use "Best-Fit" behavior to replace characters in command line given to Win32 API functions. PHP CGI module may misinterpret those characters as PHP options, which may allow a malicious user to pass options to PHP bina

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T14:08:22.593Z ##

Symantec: New Backdoor Targeting Taiwan Employs Stealthy Communications
Symantec describes a new backdoor (dubbed Msupedge) targeting a Taiwanese university. The most notable feature of this backdoor is that it communicates with a Command and Control (C2) server via DNS traffic. They provide a short technical analysis of Msupedge. Symantec suggests that the initial access vector was through CVE-2024-4577 (9.8 critical, disclosed 06 June 2024 by PHP, added to CISA KEV Catalog 12 June 2024) PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability.) IOC provided.

See related The Hacker News reporting: Hackers Exploit PHP Vulnerability to Deploy Stealthy Msupedge Backdoor

#threatintel #msupedge #malwareanalysis #cyberespionage #IOC #CVE_2024_4577 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #PHP #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T14:08:22.000Z ##

Symantec: New Backdoor Targeting Taiwan Employs Stealthy Communications
Symantec describes a new backdoor (dubbed Msupedge) targeting a Taiwanese university. Symantec suggests that the initial access vector was through CVE-2024-4577 (9.8 critical, disclosed 06 June 2024 by PHP, added to CISA KEV Catalog 12 June 2024) PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability.) ##

CVE-2024-41164
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-14T15:31:19

2 posts

When TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a Virtual Server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attackers control can cause TMM to terminate. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T13:23:49.362Z ##

F5 Security advisories. No mention of exploitation:

  • K000140111: BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerability CVE-2024-39809
    • CVE-2024-39809 (CVSSv4 8.9 high) BIG-IP Next Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire.
  • K000140108: NGINX Plus MQTT vulnerability CVE-2024-39792
    • CVE-2024-39792 (CVSSv4 8.7 high) When NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT filter module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

#F5 #BIGIP #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T13:23:49.000Z ##

F5 Security advisories. No mention of exploitation:

  • K000140111: BIG-IP Next Central Manager vulnerability CVE-2024-39809
    • CVE-2024-39809 (CVSSv4 8.9 high) BIG-IP Next Central Manager user session refresh token does not expire.
  • K000140108: NGINX Plus MQTT vulnerability CVE-2024-39792
    • CVE-2024-39792 (CVSSv4 8.7 high) When NGINX Plus is configured to use the MQTT filter module, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
  • K000138477: BIG-IP MPTCP vulnerability CVE-2024-41164
    • CVE-2024-41164 (CVSSv4 8.2 high) When a TCP profile with Multipath TCP enabled (MPTCP) is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed traffic along with conditions beyond the attacker's control can cause the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to terminate.

CVE-2024-38213
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.42%

updated 2024-08-14T14:55:49.887000

21 posts

Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-17T00:25:02.000Z ##

Copy2Pwn Vulnerability Bypasses Windows Protections https://thecyberexpress.com/copy2pwn-hack-bypasses-windows-protections/ #WindowsDefenderSmartScreen #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202421412 #CVE202436025 #CVE202438213 #copy2pwn #WebDAV

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-17T00:25:02.000Z ##

Copy2Pwn Vulnerability Bypasses Windows Protections https://thecyberexpress.com/copy2pwn-hack-bypasses-windows-protections/ #WindowsDefenderSmartScreen #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202421412 #CVE202436025 #CVE202438213 #copy2pwn #WebDAV

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.719Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

#threatintel #CVE_2024_38213 #windows #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #darkgate #webDAV #motw #markoftheweb

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

#threatintel #CVE_2024_38213 #windows #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #darkgate #webDAV #motw #markoftheweb

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-17T00:25:02.000Z ##

Copy2Pwn Vulnerability Bypasses Windows Protections https://thecyberexpress.com/copy2pwn-hack-bypasses-windows-protections/ #WindowsDefenderSmartScreen #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202421412 #CVE202436025 #CVE202438213 #copy2pwn #WebDAV

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-17T00:25:02.000Z ##

Copy2Pwn Vulnerability Bypasses Windows Protections https://thecyberexpress.com/copy2pwn-hack-bypasses-windows-protections/ #WindowsDefenderSmartScreen #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202421412 #CVE202436025 #CVE202438213 #copy2pwn #WebDAV

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T15:59:01.719Z ##

Zero Day Initiative (ZDI): CVE-2024-38213: Copy2Pwn Exploit Evades Windows Web Protection
ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. "Threat actors have discovered that Windows does not always handle or properly apply the Mark-of-the-Web to files served over WebDAV."

#threatintel #CVE_2024_38213 #windows #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #darkgate #webDAV #motw #markoftheweb

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

ZDI provides the deets on CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. Bleeping Computer originally broke the news that this Windows SmartScreen bypass was exploited as zero-day since March 2024, and that Microsoft actually patched it in June but forgot to disclose it. (imagine forgetting about announcing an exploited zero-day, fuck you Microsoft)

So Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative Threat Hunting team disclosed how DarkGate operators bypassed Mark-of-the-Web (MotW) protections using CVE-2024-38213, by explaining Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV), and how threat actors hosted payloads on WebDAV shares. screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

##
jbhall56 at 2024-08-16T11:59:57.597Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-38213 and named Copy2Pwn by ZDI, was fixed by Microsoft in June 2024, but it was only disclosed when the tech giant released the August 2024 Patch Tuesday updates. https://www.securityweek.com/copy2pwn-zero-day-exploited-to-bypass-windows-protections/

##
thezdi at 2024-08-15T15:42:23.358Z ##

Microsoft fixed CVE-2024-38213 last Tuesday. It was discovered in the wild by ZDI threat hunter @gothburz. Today, he makes the details of the vulnerability and how it's being used by threat actors. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/8/14/cve-2024-38213-copy2pwn-exploit-evades-windows-web-protections

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T17:36:35.688Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

CVE-2024-7593
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-14T02:07:05.410000

5 posts

Incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm in Ivanti vTM other than versions 22.2R1 or 22.7R2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication of the admin panel.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-14T08:53:29.590Z ##

CRITICAL : CVE-2024-7593 :: CVSS Score 9.8 Authentication Bypass Vulnerability Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM) that could lead to complete SYSTEM Compromise.

Advisory:

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Virtual-Traffic-Manager-vTM-CVE-2024-7593?language=en_US
