##
adulau at 2024-08-14T06:56:41.841Z ##

Incorrect implementation of an authentication algorithm in Ivanti vTM other than versions 22.2R1 or 22.7R2 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication of the admin panel.

🔗
https://vulnerability.circl.lu/vuln/CVE-2024-7593

#ivanti #vulnerability #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T14:26:56.847Z ##

Ivanti security advisories: August Security Update
Today, fixes have been released for the following solutions: Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, Ivanti Avalanche and Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM).

  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM
  • Ivanti Avalanche 6.4.4
  • Ivanti Virtual Traffic Manager (vTM )

The concerning CVEs:

  • CVE-2024-7569 (9.6 critical) An information disclosure vulnerability in Ivanti ITSM on-prem and Neurons for ITSM
  • CVE-2024-7593 (9.8 critical) authentication bypass in Ivanti vTM (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
    • "We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure. However, a Proof of Concept is publicly available"

"We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild. These vulnerabilities do not impact any other Ivanti products or solutions."

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Ivanti warns of critical vTM auth bypass with public exploit

#CVE #PatchTuesday #Ivanti #vulnerability

CVE-2024-38206
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-14T00:15:08.213000

8 posts

An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-22T07:31:02.000Z ##

📬 Microsoft Copilot Studio: Datenleck durch SSRF-Schwachstelle möglich
#Datenschutz #ITSicherheit #CopilotStudio #CVE202438206 #Microsoft #Sicherheitslücke #SSRF #SSRFSchwachstelle https://sc.tarnkappe.info/8a01bf

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-22T07:31:02.000Z ##

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-22T07:31:02.000Z ##

📬 Microsoft Copilot Studio: Datenleck durch SSRF-Schwachstelle möglich
#Datenschutz #ITSicherheit #CopilotStudio #CVE202438206 #Microsoft #Sicherheitslücke #SSRF #SSRFSchwachstelle https://sc.tarnkappe.info/8a01bf

##
tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-22T07:31:02.000Z ##

📬 Microsoft Copilot Studio: Datenleck durch SSRF-Schwachstelle möglich
#Datenschutz #ITSicherheit #CopilotStudio #CVE202438206 #Microsoft #Sicherheitslücke #SSRF #SSRFSchwachstelle https://sc.tarnkappe.info/8a01bf

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T14:38:12.026Z ##

Tenable: SSRFing the Web with the help of Copilot Studio
See parent toot above for the initial security advisory.
Tenable provides a technical analysis of CVE-2024-38206 (Microsoft considers it a 8.5 high, NVD evaluated it as 6.5 medium) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. They leveraged Copilot's ability to make external web requests in a server-side request forgery (SSRF). Coupled with an SSRF protection bypass, Tenable researchers were able to get access to Microsoft's internal infrastructure for Copilot Studio, including the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) and internal Cosmos DB instances. This included access to potentially sensitive information regarding service internals with potential cross-tenant impact. They noted that the infrastructure used for this Copilot Studio service was shared among tenants. Any impact on that infrastructure could affect multiple customers.

#CVE_2024_38206 #SSRF #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #CopilotStudio #copilot

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T14:38:12.000Z ##

Tenable: SSRFing the Web with the help of Copilot Studio
See parent toot above for the initial security advisory.
Tenable provides a technical analysis of CVE-2024-38206 (Microsoft considers it a 8.5 high, NVD evaluated it as 6.5 medium) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. They leveraged Copilot's ability to make external web requests in a server-side request forgery (SSRF). Coupled with an SSRF protection bypass, Tenable researchers were able to get access to Microsoft's internal infrastructure for Copilot Studio, including the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) and internal Cosmos DB instances. This included access to potentially sensitive information regarding service internals with potential cross-tenant impact. They noted that the infrastructure used for this Copilot Studio service was shared among tenants. Any impact on that infrastructure could affect multiple customers.

#CVE_2024_38206 #SSRF #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #CopilotStudio #copilot

##

CVE-2024-38140
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:24

4 posts

Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.690Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.000Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

#CVE_2024_38140 #microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #RMCAST

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-16T20:27:47.690Z ##

So in reading up on CVE-2024-38140 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Reliable Multicast Transport Driver (RMCAST) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, I learned that a team called Microsoft Offensive Research & Security Engineering (MORSE) exists! Someone from MORSE was credited with disclosing it. (I personally would have saved the zero-day for a rainy day.) The only other information we have is from the FAQ:

An unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending specially crafted packets to a Windows Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) open socket on the server, without any interaction from the user.

This sounds very similar to the IPv6 RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-38063 that got everyone wildin. Except this one's CWE (referring to CVE-2024-38140) is Use After Free (CWE-416).

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

CVE-2022-27486
(6.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:24

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiDDoS version 5.5.0 through 5.5.1, 5.4.2 through 5.4.0, 5.3.0 through 5.3.1, 5.2.0, 5.1.0, 5.0.0, 4.7.0, 4.6.0 and 4.5.0 and FortiDDoS-F version 6.3.0 through 6.3.1, 6.2.0 through 6.2.2, 6.1.0 through 6.1.4 allows an authenticated attacker to execute shell code as `root` via `execute` CLI c

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.511Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

#Fortinet #cve #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.000Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

##

CVE-2022-45862
(3.7 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:24

2 posts

An insufficient session expiration vulnerability [CWE-613] vulnerability in FortiOS 7.2.5 and below, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions; FortiProxy 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions; FortiPAM 1.3 all versions, 1.2 all versions, 1.1 all versions, 1.0 all versions; FortiSwitchManager 7.2.1 and below, 7.0 all versions GUI may allow attackers to re-use websessions after GUI logout, should they manage

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.511Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

#Fortinet #cve #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-21757
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:23

2 posts

A unverified password change in Fortinet FortiManager versions 7.0.0 through 7.0.10, versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.4, and versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, as well as Fortinet FortiAnalyzer versions 7.0.0 through 7.0.10, versions 7.2.0 through 7.2.4, and versions 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, allows an attacker to modify admin passwords via the device configuration backup.

CVE-2024-36505
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:23

2 posts

An improper access control vulnerability [CWE-284] in FortiOS 7.4.0 through 7.4.3, 7.2.5 through 7.2.7, 7.0.12 through 7.0.14 and 6.4.x may allow an attacker who has already successfully obtained write access to the underlying system (via another hypothetical exploit) to bypass the file integrity checking system.

CVE-2024-38193
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:21

22 posts

Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-20T08:06:02.000Z ##

📬 FudModule: Ausgefeiltes Rootkit gräbt sich tief in Windows ein
#Cyberangriffe #ITSicherheit #Avast #CVE202438193 #FudModule #Hacker #Lazarus #WindowsSicherheit https://sc.tarnkappe.info/00e236

##
tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-08-20T08:06:02.000Z ##

📬 FudModule: Ausgefeiltes Rootkit gräbt sich tief in Windows ein
#Cyberangriffe #ITSicherheit #Avast #CVE202438193 #FudModule #Hacker #Lazarus #WindowsSicherheit https://sc.tarnkappe.info/00e236

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T13:26:57.443Z ##

Gen Digital: Safeguarding Digital Freedom: How a Gen Discovery Helped to Protect Windows Users Everywhere
Reference: CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog same day) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
In June 2024, Gen researchers discovered the North Korean state-sponsored APT Lazarus Group exploiting a hidden security flaw in a crucial part of Windows called the AFD.sys driver. This flaw allowed them to gain unauthorized access to sensitive system areas. They also discovered that they used a special type of malware called Fudmodule to hide their activities from security software.
See related The Hacker News reporting: Microsoft Patches Zero-Day Flaw Exploited by North Korea's Lazarus Group

#CVE_2024_38193 #northkorea #lazarus #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #vulnerability #microsoft #threatintel

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_38189 #CVE_2024_38178 #CVE_2024_38213 #CVE_2024_38193 #CVE_2024_38106 #CVE_2024_38107 #zeroday #Microsoft #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE

August 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary

August Patch Tuesday Release Note :
https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Aug

The following are the 6 zero-day flaws exploited in the wild..

CVE-2024-38189 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38189
CVE-2024-38178 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38178
CVE-2024-38213 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38213
CVE-2024-38193 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38193
CVE-2024-38106 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38106
CVE-2024-38107 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38107

Remaining 4 Zero-Day Flaws:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38202
CVE-2024-38200 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38200

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T17:36:35.688Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 87 vulnerabilities, 7 zero-days (6 exploited)

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

CVE-2024-38178
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.30%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:21

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T19:04:41.470Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Six Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds all the Microsoft zero days to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Microsoft Windows Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Microsoft Windows Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38189 (8.8 high) Microsoft Project Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38107 (7.8 high) Windows Power Dependency Coordinator Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38106 (7.0 high) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38213 (6.5 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38193 (7.8 high) Windows Ancillary Function Driver for WinSock Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (exploited)
  • CVE-2024-38199 (9.8 critical) Windows Line Printer Daemon (LPD) Service Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (publicly disclosed)

##

CVE-2024-38218
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:20

1 posts

Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38200 #CVE_2024_38218 #CVE_2024_38219 #Chromium #Chrome

##

CVE-2024-7589
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:18

4 posts

A signal handler in sshd(8) may call a logging function that is not async-signal-safe. The signal handler is invoked when a client does not authenticate within the LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default). This signal handler executes in the context of the sshd(8)'s privileged code, which is not sandboxed and runs with full root privileges. This issue is another instance of the problem in CVE-20

alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-14T15:53:03.000Z ##

FreeBSD released a security update for a high-severity OpenSSH flaw (CVE-2024-7589) that allows remote code execution. Users should update and restart sshd or set LoginGraceTime to 0 to mitigate risks.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/freebsd-issues-critical-update-to-patch-openssh-vulnerability/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-13T06:04:54.696Z ##

CVE-2024-7589 :: regreSSHion type vulnerability in FreeBSD.

Advisory:
https://www.freebsd.org/security/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-24:08.openssh.asc

CVE-2024-38219
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-13T18:31:18

1 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.597Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T11:00:08.000Z ##

Unpatched MS Office flaw may leak NTLM hashes to attackers (CVE-2024-38200) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/12/cve-2024-38200/ #authentication #Microsoft365 #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #MSOffice #PrivSec #0-day #News

##
alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-12T09:50:34.000Z ##

Microsoft reported a critical Office vulnerability (CVE-2024-38200) that could let attackers access NTLM hashes and login credentials. It affects Office 2016, 2019, LTSC 2021, and Microsoft 365. Users should update immediately and block NTLM traffic.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/microsoft-urges-updates-for-office-vulnerability-allowing-ntlm-hash-and-login-data-theft/

##

CVE-2024-7272
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-13T15:31:34

2 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in FFmpeg up to 5.1.5. This affects the function fill_audiodata of the file /libswresample/swresample.c. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. This issue was fixed in version 6.0 by 9903ba28c28ab18dc7b7b6fb8571cc8b5caae1a6 but a backport for 5.1 was forgotten. The exploit ha

neurovagrant@masto.deoan.org at 2024-08-22T12:38:10.000Z ##

Ah lovely, 8.8 CVE with published POC in ffmpeg.

CVE-2024-7272 (published 2024-08-12, I must have missed it then)

Editing to add: see better information from Gossi:

https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog/113005928800565295

#infosec

https://securityonline.info/cve-2024-7272-critical-heap-overflow-vulnerability-discovered-in-ffmpeg-poc-published/

##

##

CVE-2024-41730
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T12:58:25.437000

3 posts

In SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform, if Single Signed On is enabled on Enterprise authentication, an unauthorized user can get a logon token using a REST endpoint. The attacker can fully compromise the system resulting in High impact on confidentiality, integrity and availability.

jbhall56 at 2024-08-14T11:42:10.084Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-41730 and rated 9.8 as per the CVSS v3.1 system, is a "missing authentication check" bug impacting SAP BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform versions 430 and 440 and is exploitable under certain conditions. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sap-flaw-allows-remote-attackers-to-bypass-authentication/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-14T04:21:34.227Z ##

CVE-2024-43160
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-13T12:31:01

2 posts

Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type vulnerability in BerqWP allows Code Injection.This issue affects BerqWP: from n/a through 1.7.6.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

CVE-2024-5527
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-12T15:31:01

2 posts

Zohocorp ManageEngine ADAudit Plus versions below 8110 are vulnerable to authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T11:26:57.331Z ##

Zoho ManageEngine security advisories:

  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5527) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5527 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in file auditing configuration
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-5487) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-5487 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's export option
  • Authenticated SQL Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2024-36518) fixed in ADAudit Plus build 8110 CVE-2024-36518 (vendor 8.3 high) authenticated SQL Injection in attack surface analyzer's dashboard

No mention of exploitation. Mitre and NVD only have publish dates from yesterday 12 August 2024, even though the Zoho advisories marked them fixed 14 June 2024. Zoho also doesn't indicate when the advisories were published. Happy #PatchTuesday

#Zoho #vulnerability #cve

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T15:30:50

1 posts

An issue was discovered whereby Elastic Agent will leak secrets from the agent policy elastic-agent.yml only when the log level is configured to debug. By default the log level is set to info, where no leak occurs.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T23:38:40.000Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elastic Agent 8.15.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-23)
CVE-2024-37283 (CVSSv4: 6.5 medium) Elastic Agent Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File (ESA-2024-23)
No mention of exploitation. No Elastic Cloud customers are affected. The issue is resolved in version 8.15.0.

CVE-2024-7438
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T13:38:43.203000

2 posts

A vulnerability has been found in SimpleMachines SMF 2.1.4 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /index.php?action=profile;u=2;area=showalerts;do=read of the component User Alert Read Status Handler. The manipulation of the argument aid leads to improper control of resource identifiers. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T04:12:39.839Z ##

@Sempf if I'm not mistaken, this is CVE-2024-7438 (CVSSv4: 5.3 or CVSSv3 4.3 medium)

A vulnerability has been found in SimpleMachines SMF 2.1.4 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /index.php?action=profile;u=2;area=showalerts;do=read of the component User Alert Read Status Handler. The manipulation of the argument aid leads to improper control of resource identifiers. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

  • CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

EDIT: actually might be unrelated. Concerning how many PoCs are floating around for SMF

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T04:12:39.000Z ##

@Sempf if I'm not mistaken, this is CVE-2024-7438 (CVSSv4: 5.3 or CVSSv3 4.3 medium)

A vulnerability has been found in SimpleMachines SMF 2.1.4 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /index.php?action=profile;u=2;area=showalerts;do=read of the component User Alert Read Status Handler. The manipulation of the argument aid leads to improper control of resource identifiers. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

  • CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:N/VC:N/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N
  • CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

EDIT: actually might be unrelated. Concerning how many PoCs are floating around for SMF

CVE-2024-7348
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-08T15:31:31

1 posts

Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in pg_dump in PostgreSQL allows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the user running pg_dump, which is often a superuser. The attack involves replacing another relation type with a view or foreign table. The attack requires waiting for pg_dump to start, but winning the race condition is trivial if the attacker retains an open tr

##

CVE-2024-42219
(7.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T21:32:50

3 posts

1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

1 repos

#search_error

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-09T12:35:04.000Z ##

Critical 1Password flaws may allow hackers to snatch your passwords (CVE-2024-42219, CVE-2024-42218) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/09/cve-2024-42219-cve-2024-42218/ #securityassessment #passwordmanager #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #1Password #passwords #Hotstuff #macOS #News #CVE

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T19:43:03.000Z ##

CVE-2024-42219 for #1Password 8 for Mac

"To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI."

No evidence of exploitation in the wild.

Naturally, you'd also have other issues alongside this (such as potentially dealing with other malware being dropped on the device, like RATs or infostealers).

I usually stick to and prefer Bitwarden... but for anyone using 1Password out there (once upon a time, I did) on macOS, make sure to update to 1Password for macOS version 8.10.36

#apple #security #macos #cybersecurity

https://support.1password.com/kb/202408a/

kurtseifried@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T17:12:22.000Z ##

CVE-2024-34750
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-04T05:01:04

2 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When processing an HTTP/2 stream, Tomcat did not handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. This led to a miscounting of active HTTP/2 streams which in turn led to the use of an incorrect infinite timeout which allowed connections to remain open which should have been closed.

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:

    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF

  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-11T14:36:15.000Z ##

Microsoft: Chained for attack: OpenVPN vulnerabilities discovered leading to RCE and LPE
I didn't write about this earlier because more pressing issues were coming out (such as all the unpatched vulnerabilities from Microsoft, Ivanti, Fortinet and Cisco)
Microsoft found multiple medium severity vulnerabilities in OpenVPN:

  • CVE-2024-27459 (7.5 high) Denial of service (DoS), local privilege escalation (LPE) for Windows
  • CVE-2024-24974 (7.5 high) Unauthorized access
  • CVE-2024-27903 (NVD 9.8 critical) Remote code execution (RCE) for Windows, Local privilege escalation (LPE), data manipulation for Android, iOS, macOS, BSD
  • CVE-2024-1305 (9.8 critical) Denial of service (DoS)

This was presented at Black Hat USA 2024. Microsoft provides an overview of OpenVPN, a technical analysis and vulnerability analyses. This includes remote code execution by chaining CVE-2024-24974 and CVE-2024-27903, or local privilege execution using CVE-2024-27459 and CVE-2024-27903. Microsoft provides mitigation and protection guidance (hunting queries).

#OpenVPN #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_27459 #CVE_2024_24974 #CVE_2024_27903 #CVE_2024_1305

CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 71.47%

updated 2024-07-30T02:15:08.387000

3 posts

A security regression (CVE-2006-5051) was discovered in OpenSSH's server (sshd). There is a race condition which can lead sshd to handle some signals in an unsafe manner. An unauthenticated, remote attacker may be able to trigger it by failing to authenticate within a set time period.

1 repos

#search_error

dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev@dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev at 2024-08-15T13:11:00.000Z ##

committed; sq; CSVs Are Kinda Bad

Three data-focused resources are on tap for this fine Thursday!

Type your email…

Subscribe

TL;DR

(This is an AI-generated summary of today’s Drop using Sonnet via Perplexity.)

  • committed: A utility for monitoring GitHub repository changes via Atom feeds, available in Bash and Go versions (https://codeberg.org/hrbrmstr/committed)
  • sq: A versatile command-line tool for data wrangling and querying across various structured data sources, combining SQL functionality with jq-like querying (https://sq.io/)
  • CSVs Are Kinda Bad: A proposal to replace CSV with DSV (Delimiter-Separated Values) using ASCII separator characters, improving data handling and parsing (https://matthodges.com/posts/2024-08-12-csv-bad-dsv-good/)

committed

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]Photo by Tara Winstead on Pexels.com

Longtime Drop readers may remember that I moved to Codeberg for all my public/social coding development/projects. However, my workplace still makes heavy use of GitHub, and a number of projects I rely on both inside and outside the work context are firmly entrenched in Microsoft’s horrid ecosystem.

Some of said reliant repos are ones that use GitHub and GitHub actions as a means to maintain a dataset, like my one that archives CISA’s KEV catalog. That particular repo is kind enough to have an associated GitHub repo website that makes the datasets available directly via a web request. The ones that do not forces the need to pull the latest changes. Writing a scheduled job to just pull a repo regularly and git diff what’s changed is somewhat wasteful of resources, and may not be run frequently enough to catch critical repo updates.

Thankfully GitHub provides Atom feeds for all sorts of elements in its ecosystem.

There are Atom feeds for:

  • issues (https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/issues.atom)
  • releases (https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/releases.atom)
  • users (https://github.com/{username}.atom)

and more, including commits (https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}/commits/{branch}.atom). So, my KEV one would bd https://github.com/hrbrmstr/cisa-known-exploited-vulns/commits.atom.

Since polling these Atom feeds are far less bandwidth intensive, we can poll them pretty frequently from an external system, then check to see if the latest commit is different than the last one we pulled, and have that trigger an action.

There are absolutely systems and frameworks that can help with such an idiom, but I threw together a small utility I dubbed committed that is super focused on this singular task and strives to be as easy to use as possible (this, along with work and personal committments are the reason for no Drop yesterday).

There are two versons of committed in that Codeberg repo:

  • committed.sh is a pure Bash script that relies on the availablilty of curl and sed to accomplish the above task
  • there’s also a small Golang CLI in the repo meant more to be a starting point to expand upon in the event you have more programmatic-intensive actions to perform on a repo change and do not want to rely on adding third-party shell utilities/commands (especially handy for a lambda function so you can just ship a single compiled binary vs. all those deps).

Just supply:

  • a commit hash cache file
  • an Atom feed URL
  • path to a command to run

to either version of committed, and let it do its thing.

On first run, it will just cache the latest commit hash, so you should seed said cache with garbage if you want it to do something on that first run. Here’s a toy example for that:

# seed the cachetmpCache=$(mktemp)echo "${RANDOM}" > "${tmpCache}"committed.sh "${tmpCache}" "https://github.com/trickest/cve/commits.atom" fortune# OR, for the Go versioncommited -last-commit "${tmpCache}" -feed-url "https://github.com/trickest/cve/commits.atom" -execute fortune

It’s MIT licensed so go bonkers with it, and please ignore/forgive the terrible sed regex hack I made to avoid reliance on a third-party XML tool.

sq

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]

sq (GH) is a fairly new-ish command-line tool engineered for data wrangling and querying across a diverse array of structured data sources. It seamlessly integrates SQL database functionality with jq-like querying capabilities, and serves as a kind of “Swiss Army Knife” for data manipulation and analysis. A short, one-line descriptions might be “jq for SQL sources”, but that’s not doing it justice.

Along with the superpower of letting folks use familiar jq syntax for queries, sq helps unity multi-source querying across many data sources, including SQL databases such as SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQL Server, while also handling document formats like CSV, Excel, and JSON.

This tool makes it dead simple to handle cross-source joins (something I really like[d] about Apache Drill, and do like about duckd). This lets us, say, merge an Excel worksheet with a PostgreSQL table (which should really be illegal, and probably is in Florida). It’s fairly diverse on the output side as well, with support for multiple formats, including JSON, CSV, Excel, HTML, Markdown, and XML (that last one should also be illegal in 2024).

It’s not just a query tool, too, as it also lets us perform direct data insertion into database tables.

sq also has inspection and diffing commands that enable comparing data across sources or tables. And, it’s even a lightweight database admin tool, letting us perform management tasks like copying, truncating, and dropping tables.

This is the commands overview:

  • add: Add data source
  • src: Get or set active data source
  • group: Get or set active group
  • ls: List sources and groups
  • mv: Move/rename sources and groups
  • rm: Remove data source or group
  • inspect: Inspect data source schema and stats
  • ping: Ping data sources
  • sql: Execute DB-native SQL query or statement
  • tbl: Useful table actions (copy, truncate, drop)
  • db: Useful database actions
  • diff: BETA: Compare sources, or tables
  • driver: Manage drivers
  • config: Manage config
  • cache: Manage cache

Here’s a short example, but the documentation site and GitHub are extremely well-documented, with plenty more examples, tutorials, and cookbook items to peruse:

$ curl --silent --fail --output inthewild.db "https://pub-4c1eae2a180542b19ea7c88f1e4ccf07.r2.dev/inthewild.db"$ sq add ./inthewild.db --handle @itw@itw  sqlite3  inthewild.db$ sq inspect @itwSOURCE  DRIVER   NAME          FQ NAME            SIZE     TABLES  VIEWS  LOCATION@itw    sqlite3  inthewild.db  inthewild.db.main  130.7MB  4       0      sqlite3:///Users/hrbrmstr/projects/sq/inthewild.dbNAME              TYPE   ROWS    COLS_litestream_lock  table  0       id_litestream_seq   table  1       id, seqexploits          table  99990   id, referenceURL, timeStamp, source, typevulns             table  260013  id, referenceURL, description, lastUpdated$ sq --src @itw sql "SELECT id, lastUpdated FROM vulns LIMIT 5"id             lastUpdatedCVE-1999-0001  2010-12-16CVE-1999-0002  2009-01-26CVE-1999-0003  2018-10-30CVE-1999-0004  2018-10-12CVE-1999-0005  2008-09-09$ sq --json --src @itw '.vulns | where(.id == "CVE-2021-44228") | .description'[  {    "description": "Apache Log4j2 2.0-beta9 through 2.15.0…"  }]

Having just said many nice thing about this tool, the sweet spot for it seems to be letting folks who prefer jq syntax over SQL use jq syntax on SQL data sources. I still prefer SQL over any other query language, so I’ll be sticking with duckdb, which has all of the other superpowers wrapped in an ALL CAPS (not really necessary) relational algebra.

Oh, and the shell completions sq installs are some of the best I’ve ever seen. Check it out just for those.

CSVs Are Kinda Bad

[🖼 dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/wp-cont…]

Super quick section!

Matt Hodges makes a case for abandoning the venerable CSV format in favor of substituting out commas (or tabs/pipes/etc) for ASCII separator characters, which are:

  • ␜ File separator character: separates logical records
  • ␝ Group separator character: separates fields
  • ␞ Record separator character: separates repeated subfields
  • ␟ Unit separator character: separates information items

It’s a good read that also shows how to make a basic Python package.

I think it’s kind of a shame we also don’t see more use of these ASCII characters in other contexts. In particular, I kind of wish there was more json-seq out there.

FIN

Remember, you can follow and interact with the full text of The Daily Drop’s free posts on Mastodon via @dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev@dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev ☮️

https://dailydrop.hrbrmstr.dev/2024/08/15/drop-517-2024-08-15-thursdataday/

hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-08-12T14:43:37.000Z ##

For enterpri$e folk, we've made it pretty simple to get exploitation information for a given CVE (tags map to CVEs but the GNQL query to do the same wasn't as easy and we return lots more info now).

Tap this and start free trial to see the new interface and the API (also has integrations into Splunk, Cortex, Nucleus,.etc).

https://viz.greynoise.io/cves/CVE-2021-44228?days=30

CVE-2024-3596(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-23T09:30:39

2 posts

RADIUS Protocol under RFC 2865 is susceptible to forgery attacks by a local attacker who can modify any valid Response (Access-Accept, Access-Reject, or Access-Challenge) to any other response using a chosen-prefix collision attack against MD5 Response Authenticator signature.

1 repos

https://github.com/alperenugurlu/CVE-2024-3596-Detector

screaminggoat at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.511Z ##

  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T16:35:39.000Z ##

Fortinet security advisories for #PatchTuesday:

  • FG-IR-22-445 CVE-2022-45862 (3.7 low) GUI Console WebSockets do not terminate on logout
  • FG-IR-24-012 CVE-2024-36505 (5.1 medium) Real-time file system integrity checking write protection bypass
  • FG-IR-22-047 CVE-2022-27486(6.7 medium) OS command injections in execute CLI commands
  • FG-IR-24-255 RADIUS Protocol CVE-2024-3596 (Fortinet gives it a 6.5 medium) aka #BlastRADIUS
  • FG-IR-23-467 CVE-2024-21757 (6.1 medium) Priviledged admin able to modify super-admins password
  • FG-IR-23-088 CVE-2023-26211 (6.8 medium) XSS vulnerability in communications triggered in playbooks

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-3596 was publicly disclosed 09 July 2024.

#Fortinet #cve #vulnerability

##

CVE-2019-1003030
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 8.98%

updated 2024-07-16T20:28:14

4 posts

A sandbox bypass vulnerability exists in Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2.63 and earlier in pom.xml, src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/workflow/cps/CpsGroovyShell.java that allows attackers able to control pipeline scripts to execute arbitrary code on the Jenkins master JVM.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

CVE-2024-38475
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T15:31:25

1 posts

Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure. Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the su

1 repos

https://github.com/p0in7s/CVE-2024-38475

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-09T14:49:06.000Z ##

F5 security advisory: K000140620: Apache HTTPD vulnerabilities CVE-2024-38474 and CVE-2024-38475
F5 confirmed that their BIG-IP, BIG-IQ and Traffix SDC are vulnerable to Apache HTTPD vulnerabilities CVE-2024-38474 and CVE-2024-38475 (see parent toot above for information on these vulnerabilities).

#CVE_2024_38474 #CVE_2024_38475 #F5 #BIGIP #Apache #HTTPD #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-5535
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T14:15:16.790000

3 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

##

CVE-2024-27459
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-11T15:31:50

1 posts

The interactive service in OpenVPN 2.6.9 and earlier allows an attacker to send data causing a stack overflow which can be used to execute arbitrary code with more privileges.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-11T14:36:15.000Z ##

Microsoft: Chained for attack: OpenVPN vulnerabilities discovered leading to RCE and LPE
I didn't write about this earlier because more pressing issues were coming out (such as all the unpatched vulnerabilities from Microsoft, Ivanti, Fortinet and Cisco)
Microsoft found multiple medium severity vulnerabilities in OpenVPN:

  • CVE-2024-27459 (7.5 high) Denial of service (DoS), local privilege escalation (LPE) for Windows
  • CVE-2024-24974 (7.5 high) Unauthorized access
  • CVE-2024-27903 (NVD 9.8 critical) Remote code execution (RCE) for Windows, Local privilege escalation (LPE), data manipulation for Android, iOS, macOS, BSD
  • CVE-2024-1305 (9.8 critical) Denial of service (DoS)

This was presented at Black Hat USA 2024. Microsoft provides an overview of OpenVPN, a technical analysis and vulnerability analyses. This includes remote code execution by chaining CVE-2024-24974 and CVE-2024-27903, or local privilege execution using CVE-2024-27459 and CVE-2024-27903. Microsoft provides mitigation and protection guidance (hunting queries).

#OpenVPN #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_27459 #CVE_2024_24974 #CVE_2024_27903 #CVE_2024_1305

##

CVE-2024-27903
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-07-11T14:46:26.300000

2 posts

OpenVPN plug-ins on Windows with OpenVPN 2.6.9 and earlier could be loaded from any directory, which allows an attacker to load an arbitrary plug-in which can be used to interact with the privileged OpenVPN interactive service.

CVE-2024-1305
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T18:31:47

1 posts

tap-windows6 driver version 9.26 and earlier does not properly check the size data of incomming write operations which an attacker can use to overflow memory buffers, resulting in a bug check and potentially arbitrary code execution in kernel space

CVE-2024-38058
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-07-09T18:31:00

4 posts

BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-16T09:40:04.000Z ##

Microsoft désactive un correctif pour BitLocker : c’est à vous de faire les manipulations à la main ! https://www.it-connect.fr/microsoft-desactive-correctif-bitlocker-cve-2024-38058-procedure-manuelle/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #BitLocker #Microsoft

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-14T01:29:47.665Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) unexpectedly disabled fixes for CVE-2024-38058 (6.8 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability because of firmware incompatibility issues that were causing BitLocker to go into recovery mode on some devices.

Customers who want to be protected from the vulnerability can apply the mitigations described in KB5025885.

#CVE_2024_38058 #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #Bitlocker

##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) unexpectedly disabled fixes for CVE-2024-38058 (6.8 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability because of firmware incompatibility issues that were causing BitLocker to go into recovery mode on some devices.

Customers who want to be protected from the vulnerability can apply the mitigations described in KB5025885.

##

CVE-2019-1003029
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.77%

updated 2024-07-05T17:55:08

4 posts

A sandbox bypass vulnerability exists in Jenkins Script Security Plugin 1.53 and earlier in src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/scriptsecurity/sandbox/groovy/GroovySandbox.java, src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/scriptsecurity/sandbox/groovy/SecureGroovyScript.java that allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to execute arbitrary code on the Jenkins master JVM.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##

CVE-2024-22263
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-03T01:47:11.083000

4 posts

Spring Cloud Data Flow is a microservices-based Streaming and Batch data processing in Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes. The Skipper server has the ability to receive upload package requests. However, due to improper sanitization for upload path, a malicious user who has access to skipper server api can use a crafted upload request to write arbitrary file to any location on file system, may even compr

1 repos

https://github.com/securelayer7/CVE-2024-22263_Scanner

screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T14:17:47.037Z ##

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-22263: Spring Cloud Dataflow Arbitrary File Writing
"Spring Cloud Dataflow is a comprehensive toolkit designed for building and orchestrating data pipelines in a microservices architecture." SecureLayer7 provided a technical analysis of CVE-2024-22263 (8.8 high, disclosed 19 June 2024) Spring Cloud Data Flow arbitrary file write, from patch diffing to static and dynamic analysis (with proof of concept). The vulnerability exists in PackageService.java.

Here lies the issue: the upload was supposed to occur under /tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062, but due to the unfiltered name we provided, a directory traversal occurs, resulting in the path "/tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062/../../poc.

#poc #cve_2024_22263 #spring #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-22T14:17:47.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-22263: Spring Cloud Dataflow Arbitrary File Writing
"Spring Cloud Dataflow is a comprehensive toolkit designed for building and orchestrating data pipelines in a microservices architecture." SecureLayer7 provided a technical analysis of CVE-2024-22263 (8.8 high, disclosed 19 June 2024) Spring Cloud Data Flow arbitrary file write, from patch diffing to static and dynamic analysis (with proof of concept). The vulnerability exists in PackageService.java.

Here lies the issue: the upload was supposed to occur under /tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062, but due to the unfiltered name we provided, a directory traversal occurs, resulting in the path "/tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062/../../poc.

#poc #cve_2024_22263 #spring #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-22263: Spring Cloud Dataflow Arbitrary File Writing
"Spring Cloud Dataflow is a comprehensive toolkit designed for building and orchestrating data pipelines in a microservices architecture." SecureLayer7 provided a technical analysis of CVE-2024-22263 (8.8 high, disclosed 19 June 2024) Spring Cloud Data Flow arbitrary file write, from patch diffing to static and dynamic analysis (with proof of concept). The vulnerability exists in PackageService.java.

Here lies the issue: the upload was supposed to occur under /tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062, but due to the unfiltered name we provided, a directory traversal occurs, resulting in the path "/tmp/skipperUpload1128613998285237062/../../poc.

#poc #cve_2024_22263 #spring #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept

##

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

2 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-12T15:27:47.400Z ##

Morphisec: Technical Analysis: CVE-2024-30103
As promised 2 months ago, Morphisec provides a technical analysis (but no proof of concept?) of CVE-2024-30103 (CVSSv3: 8.8 high, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. (see parent toots above).
It mostly confirms what Robel Campbell of Blackpoint Cyber assessed back on 21 June 2024: that it is a bypass for a previously patched vulnerability CVE-2024-21378, and it requires valid credentials (authentication).
I was expecting more information to be honest.

cc: @GossiTheDog h/t: @mttaggart

#CVE_2024_30103 #CVE_2024_21378 #MSRC #Microsoft #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:58

2 posts

Applications that use UriComponentsBuilder in Spring Framework to parse an externally provided URL (e.g. through a query parameter) AND perform validation checks on the host of the parsed URL may be vulnerable to a open redirect https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/601.html  attack or to a SSRF attack if the URL is used after passing validation checks. This is the same as CVE-2024-22243 https

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

CVE-2024-32664
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-07T20:07:58.737000

2 posts

Suricata is a network Intrusion Detection System, Intrusion Prevention System and Network Security Monitoring engine. Prior to 7.0.5 and 6.0.19, specially crafted traffic or datasets can cause a limited buffer overflow. This vulnerability is fixed in 7.0.5 and 6.0.19. Workarounds include not use rules with `base64_decode` keyword with `bytes` option with value 1, 2 or 5 and for 7.0.x, setting `app

screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T14:14:02.255Z ##

Kaspersky: Memory corruption vulnerabilities in Suricata and FreeRDP
Kaspersky reported several vulnerabilities in Suricata and FreeRDP. Suricata is an open source network analysis and threat detection software, while FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. This blog post describes some of those vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-32664 is an out-of-bounds write in Suricata, while the six vulnerabilities in FreeRDP are a combination of out-of-bounds read/write and integer underflow/overflow types found using a FreeRDP-specific fuzzer. All of these reported vulnerabilities were patched.

#vulnerability #Suricata #FreeRDP #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-22T14:14:02.000Z ##

Kaspersky: Memory corruption vulnerabilities in Suricata and FreeRDP
Kaspersky reported several vulnerabilities in Suricata and FreeRDP. Suricata is an open source network analysis and threat detection software, while FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. This blog post describes some of those vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-32664 is an out-of-bounds write in Suricata, while the six vulnerabilities in FreeRDP are a combination of out-of-bounds read/write and integer underflow/overflow types found using a FreeRDP-specific fuzzer. All of these reported vulnerabilities were patched.

#vulnerability #Suricata #FreeRDP #cve

CVE-2023-45288
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:10.493000

2 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-15T11:36:58.117Z ##

Elastic security advisory: APM Server 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-09)
CVE-2023-45288 (5.3 medium) APM Server - Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through HTTP/2 endpoints

In an on-prem deployment APM Server has been found vulnerable if exposed directly to HTTP traffic. This vulnerability cannot be exploited on Elastic Cloud because the service is behind the Elastic Cloud proxy.

No mention of exploitation.

#cve #elastic #vulnerability

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:00.070000

2 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

xnyhps at 2024-08-13T18:20:10.256Z ##

In our writeup https://sector7.computest.nl/post/2024-06-cve-2024-20693-windows-cached-code-signature-manipulation/ about CVE-2024-20693, we noted that Microsoft did not structurally address the trust of "$KERNEL.*" Extended Attributes on SMB shares. Today's Patch Tuesday addresses #CVE-2024-38133, doing the same thing again, but in this case even an USB disk would work!

I think this may be the first time we got an "Exploitation More Likely", so achievement unlocked I guess?

#Microsoft #vulnerability #Windows #PatchTuesday

##
xnyhps@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T18:20:10.000Z ##

In our writeup https://sector7.computest.nl/post/2024-06-cve-2024-20693-windows-cached-code-signature-manipulation/ about CVE-2024-20693, we noted that Microsoft did not structurally address the trust of "$KERNEL.*" Extended Attributes on SMB shares. Today's Patch Tuesday addresses #CVE-2024-38133, doing the same thing again, but in this case even an USB disk would work!

I think this may be the first time we got an "Exploitation More Likely", so achievement unlocked I guess?

#Microsoft #vulnerability #Windows #PatchTuesday

(8.5 HIGH)

updated 2024-03-26T12:55:05.010000

1 posts

By leveraging the vulnerability, lower-privileged users of Content Manager can manipulate Content Manager clients to elevate privileges and perform unauthorized operations.

1 repos

#search_error

jabbrwcky at 2024-08-15T08:40:24.954Z ##

Coming up on 5 months since publication of CVE-2024-1973, a sev 8.5 priv elevation vuln affecting an EDRM system used extensively in govt. It's still not patched by Opentext. They took a stab at a patch, it broke stuff and rather than fix it they're now saying they'll roll it up into next major version due in Q4 sometime. Because y'know it's only vast amounts of confidential data at stake, not like it's anything important. And govt won't ever change systems because it's too hard so vendors can run roughshod over them.

1 posts

OpenSSH-portable (OpenSSH) 3.6.1p1 and earlier with PAM support enabled immediately sends an error message when a user does not exist, which allows remote attackers to determine valid usernames via a timing attack.

CVE-2021-24094
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 3.50%

updated 2024-01-07T05:05:39

2 posts

Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2021-24074.

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-08-16T06:25:12.000Z ##

@malwaretech haven’t looked at this CVE as my personal life is busy burning down, but I was at Microsoft for CVE-2021-24094 (IPv6 RCE) and a massive song and dance was made about that internally and externally, despite the finders not even being able to prove RCE and it having almost zero real world exploitability.

Not saying the same thing is happening, but sometimes the announcements are missing important context.

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-08-16T06:25:12.000Z ##

@malwaretech haven’t looked at this CVE as my personal life is busy burning down, but I was at Microsoft for CVE-2021-24094 (IPv6 RCE) and a massive song and dance was made about that internally and externally, despite the finders not even being able to prove RCE and it having almost zero real world exploitability.

Not saying the same thing is happening, but sometimes the announcements are missing important context.

##

CVE-2024-22075
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-01-05T17:22:20

2 posts

Firefly III (aka firefly-iii) before 6.1.1 allows webhooks HTML Injection.

SonarResearch at 2024-08-13T15:13:00.691Z ##

Firefly III CVE-2024-22075: When Bypassing Built-in Sanitization Might Backfire.

Check out our latest blog post to see how a Client-Side Path Traversal (CSPT) vulnerability can be used to control data that was assumed to be uncontrollable:

https://www.sonarsource.com/blog/front-end-frameworks-when-bypassing-built-in-sanitization-might-backfire/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=research&utm_content=blog-front-end-frameworks-when-bypassing-built-in-sanitization-might-backfire-240812-&utm_term=&s_category=Organic&s_source=Social%20Media&s_origin=mastodon

#appsec #security #vulnerability

##
SonarResearch@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-13T15:13:00.000Z ##

Firefly III CVE-2024-22075: When Bypassing Built-in Sanitization Might Backfire.

Check out our latest blog post to see how a Client-Side Path Traversal (CSPT) vulnerability can be used to control data that was assumed to be uncontrollable:

https://www.sonarsource.com/blog/front-end-frameworks-when-bypassing-built-in-sanitization-might-backfire/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=research&utm_content=blog-front-end-frameworks-when-bypassing-built-in-sanitization-might-backfire-240812-&utm_term=&s_category=Organic&s_source=Social%20Media&s_origin=mastodon

#appsec #security #vulnerability

##

CVE-2018-1000861
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.30%

updated 2023-12-22T14:07:25

4 posts

A code execution vulnerability exists in the Stapler web framework used by Jenkins 2.153 and earlier, LTS 2.138.3 and earlier in stapler/core/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/stapler/MetaClass.java that allows attackers to invoke some methods on Java objects by accessing crafted URLs that were not intended to be invoked this way.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/smokeintheshell/CVE-2018-1000861

https://github.com/1NTheKut/CVE-2019-1003000_RCE-DETECTION

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.

##

CVE-2023-6341
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2023-12-08T15:30:19

1 posts

Catalis (previously Icon Software) CMS360 allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to view sensitive court documents by modifying document and other identifiers in URLs. The impact varies based on the intention and configuration of a specific CMS360 installation.

north@ꩰ.com at 2024-08-12T12:37:36.000Z ##

This is the platform they switched to.

https://github.com/qwell/disclosures/blob/main/README-2023-11-30-disorder-in-the-court.md#catalis---cms360

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-6341

##

CVE-2022-2601
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2023-12-04T05:04:58

4 posts

A buffer overflow was found in grub_font_construct_glyph(). A malicious crafted pf2 font can lead to an overflow when calculating the max_glyph_size value, allocating a smaller than needed buffer for the glyph, this further leads to a buffer overflow and a heap based out-of-bounds write. An attacker may use this vulnerability to circumvent the secure boot mechanism.

dangoodin at 2024-08-21T01:08:09.567Z ##

Last Tuesday, loads of Linux users—many running packages released as early as this year—started reporting their devices were failing to boot. Instead, they received a cryptic error message that included the phrase: “Something has gone seriously wrong.”

The cause: an update Microsoft issued as part of its monthly patch release. It was intended to close a 2-year-old vulnerability in GRUB, an open source boot loader used to start up many Linux devices. The vulnerability, with a severity rating of 8.6 out of 10, made it possible for hackers to bypass secure boot. CVE-2022-2601 was discovered in 2022, but for unclear reasons, Microsoft patched it only last Tuesday.

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/a-patch-microsoft-spent-2-years-preparing-is-making-a-mess-for-some-linux-users/

##
AAKL at 2024-08-20T16:31:12.799Z ##

Here we go again. #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

The issue is "caused by Microsoft's decision to apply a Secure Boot Advanced Targeting (SBAT) update to block Linux boot loaders unpatched against the CVE-2022-2601 GRUB2 Secure Boot bypass vulnerability."

August #Windows updates break dual boot on some #Linux systems https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/august-windows-updates-break-dual-boot-on-some-linux-systems/ @BleepingComputer @serghei

##
dangoodin@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T01:08:09.000Z ##

Last Tuesday, loads of Linux users—many running packages released as early as this year—started reporting their devices were failing to boot. Instead, they received a cryptic error message that included the phrase: “Something has gone seriously wrong.”

The cause: an update Microsoft issued as part of its monthly patch release. It was intended to close a 2-year-old vulnerability in GRUB, an open source boot loader used to start up many Linux devices. The vulnerability, with a severity rating of 8.6 out of 10, made it possible for hackers to bypass secure boot. CVE-2022-2601 was discovered in 2022, but for unclear reasons, Microsoft patched it only last Tuesday.

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/08/a-patch-microsoft-spent-2-years-preparing-is-making-a-mess-for-some-linux-users/

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T16:31:12.000Z ##

Here we go again. #Microsoft #cybersecurity #infosec

The issue is "caused by Microsoft's decision to apply a Secure Boot Advanced Targeting (SBAT) update to block Linux boot loaders unpatched against the CVE-2022-2601 GRUB2 Secure Boot bypass vulnerability."

August #Windows updates break dual boot on some #Linux systems https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/august-windows-updates-break-dual-boot-on-some-linux-systems/ @BleepingComputer @serghei

##

CVE-2015-5317(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 4.88%

updated 2023-02-01T05:08:11

4 posts

The Fingerprints pages in Jenkins before 1.638 and LTS before 1.625.2 might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive job and build name information via a direct request.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.260Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T21:47:14.204Z ##

@jerry @kuoirad Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.
  • It's a path traversal vulnerability! a favorite of @reverseics

#CVE_2024_23897 #Jenkins #CISA #KEV #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation

CVE-2006-5229(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 1.05%

updated 2023-01-31T05:02:05

1 posts

OpenSSH portable 4.1 on SUSE Linux, and possibly other platforms and versions, and possibly under limited configurations, allows remote attackers to determine valid usernames via timing discrepancies in which responses take longer for valid usernames than invalid ones, as demonstrated by sshtime. NOTE: as of 20061014, it appears that this issue is dependent on the use of manually-set passwords th

raptor@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T21:45:40.000Z ##

@hrbrmstr @hdm @runZeroInc oh, authentication timing analysis is especially interesting, I’ll check it out! It reminds me of my first CVEs a couple of decades ago http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2003-0190 and http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2006-5229

##

CVE-2024-42472
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-42489
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.374Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w

#CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-19T18:38:22.000Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of August 12, 2024
Fun times in CVE land where vendors compete for a perfect 10.0 critical severity vulnerability:

  • CVE-2024-43160 BerqWP unrestricted file upload (code injection)
  • CVE-2024-42472 Flatpak access to files outside sandbox
  • CVE-2024-6500 WooCommerce unauth arbitrary read/delete
  • CVE-2024-42467 openHAB unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-39791 Vonets unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-42489 XWiki RCE

These are all 10.0 CVSSv3.1 scores 🥳 cc: @cR0w
